comparison.description: How to compare the stored result of the specified command to the specified value.
comparison.markdownDescription: How to compare the stored result of the specified command to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the stored result of the specified command to.
compare_to.markdownDescription: The value to compare the stored result of the specified command to.

type.description: ## Command --- [Block Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/block_condition_types/command) Compares the result of the specified command to the specified value at the position of the block. Type ID: `origins:command` --- ### ⚠️ Caution This block condition type only operates on the server-side, meaning that it cannot be used in fields that are evaluated on the client-side. --- ### Examples ```json "block_condition": { "type": "origins:command", "command": "execute align xyz if entity @e[dy=0,dx=0,dz=0]", "comparison": ">=", "compare_to": 1 } ``` This example will check if there is an entity inside the block.
type.markdownDescription: undefined## Command --- [Block Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/block_condition_types/command) Compares the result of the specified command to the specified value at the position of the block. Type ID: `origins:command` --- ### ⚠️ Caution This block condition type only operates on the server-side, meaning that it cannot be used in fields that are evaluated on the client-side. --- ### Examples ```json "block_condition": { "type": "origins:command", "command": "execute align xyz if entity @e[dy=0,dx=0,dz=0]", "comparison": ">=", "compare_to": 1 } ``` This example will check if there is an entity inside the block.
